title: Premium redesign: Lucide icons, multi-accent palette, glassmorphism+gradient luxury aesthetic

requirements.text: Replace all emoji icons across every section (Quick Access, Mess Menu, Events, Notices, Navbar, BottomPanel, Modal) with Lucide React SVG icons. Each icon should be contextually appropriate (e.g., CalendarDays for Timetable, BookOpen for Library, UtensilsCrossed for Mess Menu, Bell for Notices, Zap for Events) and sized consistently at 20–24px. Remove all emoji strings from the codebase.

quotes: Replace emojis with Lucide icons (clean, modern SVG)

acceptanceCriteria: No emoji characters appear anywhere in the rendered UI
All icons are Lucide React SVG components
Icons are consistently sized at 20–24px across all sections
Icons are contextually relevant to their card/section labels

requirements.text: Upgrade the global colour palette to a multi-accent system with forest greens (#1a3a2a, #2d5a3d, #0f2419) as the dominant base and three complementary accents used sparingly: amber/gold (#c97d2a, #e8a84a) for warmth and highlights, teal (#1a6b5a) for depth on secondary elements, and emerald (#4a9e6a) for interactive highlights. Update CSS custom properties in frontend/src/index.css and tailwind.config.js to include these tokens. Apply accents contextually: amber/gold on section headers or badge indicators, teal on secondary card borders or icon backgrounds, emerald on active states and CTA elements.

quotes: mix of colours(mainly green but few colours which match green here there)
amber/gold (#c97d2a, #e8a84a) for warmth, teal (#1a6b5a) for depth, and soft emerald highlights (#4a9e6a)

acceptanceCriteria: CSS custom properties include amber/gold, teal, and emerald tokens
Tailwind config exposes these as usable class names
Amber/gold accent appears on at least section headers or badges
Teal accent appears on secondary card borders or icon backgrounds
Emerald accent is used on active/interactive states
Forest green remains the dominant colour throughout

requirements.text: Redesign all card components (Quick Access tiles, Mess Menu meal cards, Event cards, Notice cards) with a premium mixed aesthetic: deep green-tinted glassmorphism (backdrop-blur-md, rgba(26,58,42,0.6) background), bold layered gradients as card backgrounds, 18px border-radius, a 1px border using rgba(74,158,106,0.25) for subtle emerald rim lighting, and generous internal padding (24px+). Cards should feel layered and three-dimensional through use of multiple box-shadows (inner glow + outer drop shadow). Typography inside cards should use a clear hierarchy: bold title at 16–18px, muted subtitle/metadata at 12–13px, and body text at 14px with line-height 1.6.

quotes: icons, spacing between lines, homepage look(i mean colours, elements etc) fee too basic, a high end website is need thing
Glassmorphism depth + bold gradients + refined typography — mixed for maximum premium impact

acceptanceCriteria: All card types use deep green-tinted glassmorphism backgrounds
Cards have a visible emerald rim border at 1px
Internal padding is at least 20px
Typography hierarchy is clearly distinguishable: title > subtitle > body
Cards appear three-dimensional through layered box-shadows
18px border-radius is maintained on all cards

requirements.text: Overhaul the Hero section with a dramatically premium feel: use a deep multi-stop radial gradient background (from #0f2419 at center to #1a3a2a to near-black #0a0f0b at edges). Style the 'unaIITM' heading with a gradient text effect transitioning from emerald (#4a9e6a) to amber (#e8a84a) via CSS background-clip: text. Add a premium subtitle badge (e.g., 'IIT Madras Campus Platform') with a teal-tinted glassmorphism pill shape. Increase heading font size to 56–64px on mobile, with letter-spacing -0.02em for a high-end typographic feel. Add 2–3 subtle ambient glow orbs in green/teal/amber positioned decoratively in the background at very low opacity.

quotes: homepage look(i mean colours, elements etc) fee too basic, a high end website is need thing

acceptanceCriteria: Hero heading uses a gradient text effect (emerald to amber)
Background uses a deep multi-stop radial gradient
A premium badge/pill subtitle is present below the heading
Heading is 56px+ on mobile screens
Ambient glow orbs are visible in the background at low opacity
Overall impression is dramatically more premium than before

requirements.text: Upgrade the Navbar to a premium glassmorphism bar: increase backdrop-blur to blur(24px), deepen the background to rgba(15,36,25,0.85), add a bottom border of 1px solid rgba(74,158,106,0.2) for a subtle emerald separator. Style the 'unaIITM' logo text with the same gradient text effect (emerald to amber) matching the hero heading. The hamburger icon should be replaced with a Lucide Menu icon styled with emerald colour (#4a9e6a). The dropdown menu should use a deep glassmorphism background with individual nav links styled with left-side teal accent bars on hover.

quotes: homepage look(i mean colours, elements etc) fee too basic, a high end website is need thing

acceptanceCriteria: Navbar uses backdrop-blur(24px) and deep rgba background
Logo text has emerald-to-amber gradient effect
Hamburger is replaced with Lucide Menu icon in emerald
Dropdown nav links have left-side teal accent bars on hover
A subtle emerald bottom border is visible on the navbar

requirements.text: Improve global spacing and typography hierarchy across all sections. Section titles (SectionHeader) should be 26–30px bold with a gradient underline or accent line using the amber/teal palette. Section subtitles should be 13–14px in muted off-white (#a8c4b0). Increase vertical padding between sections to at least 64px. Increase line-height to 1.65 globally for body text. Add generous top/bottom padding (16px minimum) to all list items inside BottomPanel and Modal. Apply letter-spacing: -0.01em to all headings for a premium typographic feel.

quotes: icons, spacing between lines, homepage look(i mean colours, elements etc) fee too basic

acceptanceCriteria: Section headings are 26px+ with a gradient or accent underline
Vertical section spacing is at least 64px
Global body line-height is 1.65 or greater
Headings use letter-spacing -0.01em
BottomPanel and Modal list items have 16px+ padding
Typography hierarchy is clearly distinguished throughout

requirements.text: Redesign the Mess Menu section with a premium card layout: each meal card (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner) should have a distinct accent colour applied to its header strip — amber/gold for Breakfast, emerald for Lunch, teal for Dinner. Each card header should include the Lucide icon (e.g., Coffee, UtensilsCrossed, Moon) alongside the meal name. Food items inside the card should be displayed as a styled list with subtle divider lines (1px rgba(74,158,106,0.15)). Add a 'Timings' badge below each meal title using the accent colour as background at 20% opacity.

quotes: homepage look(i mean colours, elements etc) fee too basic, a high end website is need thing

acceptanceCriteria: Breakfast card header uses amber/gold accent
Lunch card header uses emerald accent
Dinner card header uses teal accent
Each card header includes a Lucide icon
Food items have subtle divider lines between them
Timings badge is present with accent-coloured background

requirements.text: Redesign the Quick Access section tiles with a premium icon card style: each tile should have a square or rounded-square format with a gradient icon container (small 44px circle with a tinted green-to-teal or green-to-amber gradient background) centred at top, the Lucide icon inside in white, and the label text below in 12px semi-bold. The row background should use a subtle canopy-inspired pattern using CSS repeating gradients at low opacity. The BottomPanel opened from each tile should have a premium header with the tile's Lucide icon, gradient accent title, and a styled close button (X icon from Lucide in emerald).
acceptanceCriteria: Each Quick Access tile has a gradient icon container circle
Lucide icon is centred in the icon container in white
Label text is 12px semi-bold below the icon
BottomPanel header includes the corresponding Lucide icon and gradient title
BottomPanel close button uses Lucide X icon in emerald
Row background has a subtle patterned overlay

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/main.tsx
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui/
Forest green must remain the dominant colour — accents (amber, teal, emerald) must be used sparingly and not overpower the green base
All card border-radius must remain at 18px
Mobile-first layout must be preserved — all touch targets at least 44px tall
nonGoals: Adding new sections or features beyond redesigning existing ones
Adding real data or API integrations
Changing the page structure or section order
